intro: Erucaria bornmuelleri, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses worldwide.
